videoSnippet.title: Hans Calculates Like A Machine
videoSnippet.description:
Photos by Lennart Ootes https://www.chessphotoshop.com/
Have a great day :)

Niemann, Hans Moke (2699) - Lenderman, Aleksandr (2535)
U.S. Championship (chess24.com) [11] 2022.10.17
D11 Queen's Gambit Declined Slav, 4.e3

1.d4 d5 2.c4 c6 3.Nf3 Nf6 4.e3 Bg4 5.Nc3 e6 6.h3 Bh5 7.g4 Bg6 8.Ne5 Nbd7 9.Nxg6 hxg6 10.g5 Ne4 11.Nxe4 dxe4 12.h4 Bb4+ 13.Bd2 Qa5 14.a3 Bxd2+ 15.Qxd2 Qxd2+ 16.Kxd2 f5 17.c5 Ke7 18.b4 Rad8 19.Kc3 e5 20.Bc4 exd4+ 21.exd4 Nf8 22.f3 exf3 23.Raf1 Kd7 24.Rxf3 Ne6 25.Re1 Nc7 26.Rh3 Rde8 27.Rxe8 Kxe8 28.a4 Kd7 29.b5 Ne6 30.Kb4 Nf4 31.Rh2 Kc7 32.a5 cxb5 33.Bxb5 a6 34.Ba4 Ne6 35.d5 Nxg5 36.d6+ Kd8 37.c6 bxc6 38.Kc5 f4 39.Rb2 Ne6+ 40.Kxc6 Nd4+ 41.Kd5 Nb5 42.Bxb5 axb5 43.Kc6 Ke8 44.Kc7 Kf7 45.d7

00:00 Hello Everyone!
00:20 Game Starts!
02:40 Completely New Game!
07:55 Pause the Video!
11:25 It was in this position!
12:55 Contributions!

The 2022 U.S. Championship is a 14-player round-robin featuring the strongest players in the USA, who compete for $262,000 in prize money as well as the coveted title of U.S. Champion. If two or more players tie for first place a playoff will be held.

Players receive 90 minutes for the first 40 moves followed by 30 minutes for the rest of the game, with a 30-second increment from move one. Draw offers are not allowed before move 30. Official website: uschesschamps.com
